comment.author: 29877325@N07
comment._content: Photos in black and white can be so dramatic...the variations of greys etc. Painter Mr. Couse, looks intensively . Nice composition. I guess that a little bit of depth of field would help. But on the other hand, the "palette" on the foregrounds adds to  the overall composition. It is good to noticed the painting subjects, that appear to be native Americans... But he (Mr. Couse) is "the man  who commands  immediate attention, the center of the composition.

comment.author: 49015875@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E._Irving_Couse Eanger Irving Couse (1866–1936) was an American artist and a founding member and first president of the Taos Society of Artists. He is noted for paintings of Native Americans, New Mexico, and the American Southwest
